pullRequest.body:
One more PR with `simp`s squeezed thanks to #11246.

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/298c78b2-8ed9-4bb9-817a-23deb9e2efc5) for commit 6cde5975789f42ddfe8b21cd8384e434fdf5319e.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/bd1f2a5a-f027-467a-8347-386e18b39b31/to/298c78b2-8ed9-4bb9-817a-23deb9e2efc5) against commit ee18bf38f103b6c314be9e23f073eacb81e6872e.

Same as in #11281: I understood that the implementation of the "flexible linter" addresses this PR and therefore this can be closed.

Please reopen if that's not correct!
!bench
!bench

Thanks for the reviews!  I am skeptical about adding the `Decidable` instance for `Matrix.IsSymm` in the same PR.

Also, these issues are still using the old linter.  I have not yet had the time to really think through the new one, though.

I guess these could have been simp with decide turned on instead? I'm a bit wary of these. Decide is a good example of a tactic that doesn't card too much what the goal is before but might run a lot slower if the input is in a different form

Does this work?
```suggestion
          · simp [← LinearMap.ker_eq_bot, LinearMap.ker_codRestrict, ker_eq_bot_of_mono]
```
I had tried that, but it turns out that `simpa [← LinearMap.ker_eq_bot, LinearMap.ker_codRestrict] using ker_eq_bot_of_mono ..` works!

```suggestion
  natCast_zero := by simpa using rfl
```
I had not thought of `using rfl`, but it does not work here.
Can you try `simpa ... using rfl` here?
Unfortunately it does not work.

```suggestion
  map_add' x y := by simp [Finsupp.single_add, ofFinsupp_add]
```
maybe?
I had tried that and it does not work.

If you add an instance for `DecidablePred Matrix.IsSymm` (which should be pretty trivial), you will be able to golf this even further to
```suggestion
  symmetric := by decide
```
This is a false positive, right?
I think that this was not flagged by the linter, but I decided to use `aesop` anyway...  Should I open a separate PR?

pullRequest.title: chore: more squeezed simps

nodes.body: !bench

Thanks for the reviews!  I am skeptical about adding the `Decidable` instance for `Matrix.IsSymm` in the same PR.

Also, these issues are still using the old linter.  I have not yet had the time to really think through the new one, though.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/298c78b2-8ed9-4bb9-817a-23deb9e2efc5) for commit 6cde5975789f42ddfe8b21cd8384e434fdf5319e.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/bd1f2a5a-f027-467a-8347-386e18b39b31/to/298c78b2-8ed9-4bb9-817a-23deb9e2efc5) against commit ee18bf38f103b6c314be9e23f073eacb81e6872e.

Same as in #11281: I understood that the implementation of the "flexible linter" addresses this PR and therefore this can be closed.

Please reopen if that's not correct!
